disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents when I did something without their knowledge or permission?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

extracted_data_phrases: with others within my social circle
disobedience.question: When frustrated with others within my social circle, did I reject the unity of the Church, confusing its divine nature with human imperfections?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

extracted_data_phrases: especially during sacred times such as Ash Wednesday
disobedience.question: Did I deliberately disregard prescribed days for fasting, especially during sacred times such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did I use my words to belittle or scorn the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

condoning.description: As part of the corporal works of mercy, we're called to be merciful and compassionate to those in distress.

condoning.question: Did I fail to speak truthfully to my child about their mistakes, instead choosing silence to avoid an uncomfortable conversation?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

uncharity.question: Have I lost my patience with others, especially when they are struggling or in need?

uncharity.question: Did I permit others to be treated unfairly, perhaps through silence or inaction when faced with injustice or harm?
